title.narrative: BRA/10/G32 - Third National Communication to the UNFCCC (TNC)

description.narrative: The objective is to extend coverage of the annual Brazilian Inventory of Anthropogenic GHGs to period 2000-2010, focusing on the sectors/gases that have a significant share of GHG emissions and/or present a large degree of data uncertainty
independent political entity
National circumstances steps taken or envisaged constraints and needs have been assessed as input for the implementation of the UNFCCC in Brazil
A Assessment of national circumstances in Brazil

comment.narrative: A SNC data until 2005
A TNC data until 2013

All information made available by several governmental institutions was compiled in a single domcument and reviewed by several governmental parties At the moment the Document is under evaluation by the GoB

All information made available by several governmental institutions was compiled in a single domcument and reviewed by several governmental parties At the moment the Document is under evaluation by the GoB

description.narrative: D Publication of formal communication on national circumstances to the UNFCCC

comment.narrative: D SNC preliminary SNC results made public by April 2010
D TNC preliminary TNC results made public by April 2013

All information made available by several governmental institutions was compiled in a single domcument and reviewed by several governmental parties At the moment the Document is under evaluation by the GoB

description.narrative: Sector and regional vulnerabilities to climate change have been assessed using improved methodologies and climate models
A Status of Brazilian Global Model of the Climate System MBSCG

comment.narrative: A SNC no Brazilian Global model only EtaCPTEC regional model
A MBSCG developed and EtaCPTEC model improved with higher resolution for a larger domain

The Global Model of the Climate System MBSCG and the EtaCPTEC regional model were improved with higher resolution for a larger domain The coupled oceanatmosphere version of the Brazilian Earth System Model BESM former MBSCG was implemented and tested in the supercomputer Tupa installed at INPE This version of BESM is able to generate scenarios of global climate change for present time up to 2100
However a preliminary analysis identified the need for improvements in some used models Now it is necessary to investigate these gaps and needs more accurately a process that will now rely on the recent entry of Brazil in the Earth System Grid Federation ESGF through INPE
In order to enhance the countrys data assessment and management capacities which are critical to facilitate BESMs developing process after a comprehensive survey INPE proposed that the Ministry of Science Technology and Innovation of Brazil MCTI financed the Institutes insertion in the Earth System Grid Federation ESGF a ultrascale data network that provides stateoftheart online communication for the exchange of information among specialists that are contributing to BESMs completion
Thus along with the acquisition of the equipment and software required to make Brazil one of the ESGF world nods a specialist was hired to design and present workshops aimed at training INPE and other institutions researchers and public managers in this new tool Currently INPE resarchers are already using the ESGFINPE platform and the second workshop is being planned by the consultant and the TCNs Coordination team

description.narrative: B Detailed climate change scenarios based on MBSCG and regional Eta model

comment.narrative: B Limited climate change scenarios generated under SNC
B Higher number at least 4 climate change scenarios generated under TNC

Climate scenarios for the next 100 years based on the RCP 45 and RCP 85 and HadGEM scenarios generated by BESM and used by the IPCC in its AR5 prepared by experts in climate modeling of the Rede CLIMA

description.narrative: C Climate change impact assessment for key sectors agriculture water resources energy megacities and urban areas biodiversity human health

comment.narrative: C Limited CC impact assessment has been prepared under SNC
C Improved CC impact assessment has been prepared under TNC

All Terms of Reference prepared by Rede CLIMA subnetworks supported the hiring of consultants who worked under each subnetwork coordination analysing data generated through the scenario The reports were evaluated by INPE senior researchers and compiled into a single document describing each sectorial vulnerabilities

description.narrative: D Mapping of vulnerability of key sectors and regions to climate change impacts

comment.narrative: D Inadequate insight in key VA sectors due to limitations of data and methodologies under SNC
D Improved insight in key VA sectors due to improved data and methodologies under TNC

All Terms of Reference prepared by Rede CLIMA subnetworks supported the hiring of consultants who worked under each subnetwork coordination analysing data generated through the scenario The reports were evaluated by INPE senior researchers and compiled into a single document describing each sectorial vulnerabilities

description.narrative: The Brazilian Third National Communication has been published and presented to the Government and national stakeholders
A Sharing of project outputs reports GHG inventories website

comment.narrative: A Project outputs not produced
A Project reports GHG inventories and website updated and published

The team of experts and consultants involved in the Third National Communication has been mobilized in order to define along with the MCTI press office the activities that will result in the publication in different media of all outputs contained in the TNC Data platform for the GHG Inventory was finished and it is in validation and test stage

description.narrative: B Publication of Third National Communication

comment.narrative: B Preliminary SNC results made public April 2010
B TNC has been finalized and presented to the GoB

The sector responsible for institutional communications is supporting the activities needed to TCN publication Moreover the translation of the document has been already started and the bidding process for the graphic service is in course

description.narrative: C Final Evaluation Report

comment.narrative: C No FEV
C FEV completed

A final report of each work is going to be prepared jointly with both Ministry of Science Technology and Innovation and Rede CLIMA This report will cover all aspects positive and negative of the activities leading to the preparation of the TNC The independent final evaluation is being hired by UNDP

description.narrative: The national GHG inventory 20002010 has been produced and timeseries 19902000 have been refined for key emission sectors
A National GHG inventory for the sectors i energy ii industry iii agriculture iv LULUCF and v waste for 20002010 produced and timeseries 19902000 refined

comment.narrative: A GHG inventory available for period 19901994 FNC and 19902000 SNC
A GHG inventory available for the period 19902010 including refinement of timeseries 19902000
The preparation of the National GHG Inventory for the sectors i ii iii iv and v is finished At this moment the Brazilian government is evaluating the document for approval

description.narrative: B QAQC plan for GHG emission data per sector

comment.narrative: B QAQC pilot has been designed and implemented under SNC
B Analysis of key GHG emission categories and uncertainty analysis available and a QAQC plan established
The emission categories and uncertainty analysis were finished Moreover the experts of Rede CLIMA have evaluated the quality of data and methodological aspects

description.narrative: C Database of emission factors and activity data

comment.narrative: C Pilot database available under the SNC
C Data base of emission factors available
The development of the simplified database platform was finalized and at this moment it is in a validation phase by the technical team of MCTI

description.narrative: To assist the Government of Brazil to perform the activities necessary to prepare the Third National Communication to the Conference of Parties in accordance with the UNFCCC
A National GHG inventory for the sectors i energy ii industry iii agriculture iv LULUCF and v waste for 20002010 produced and timeseries 19902000 refined

comment.narrative: A SNC
A TNC

The National GHG Inventory for the sectors i ii iii iv and v was done for 20002010 and also refined for 19902000 period At this moment the Brazilian government is evaluating the inventory results for approval

description.narrative: B Publication of formal communication on national circumstances to the UNFCCC

comment.narrative: B SNC
B TNC

All information about National Circumstances and modelling studies was revised by MCTIs technical team At this moment the complete document is being evaluated by the Brazilian government to approve the submission to UNFCCC

description.narrative: C Publication of Third National Communication

comment.narrative: C SNC
C TNC

The sector responsible for institutional communications is supporting the activities needed to TNC publication Moreover the translation of the document has been already started and the bidding process for the graphic service is in course

description.narrative: D Building institutional capacity in Brazil for education training and public awareness related to climate change

comment.narrative: C SNC
D TNC

The Rede CLIMA has been playing an important role through the participation in discussions regarding climate modelling activities and emission factors for the GHG Inventory All these activities have also been responsible for the consolidation of this network as a pivotal partner of the implementation of the UNFCCC in Brazil Moreover the TNC document was available for the public consultation from October 2014 to January 2015 with the involvement of experts and representatives of civil society To strengthen the institutional capacity building for education training and public awareness related to climate change it is planned for next months to hold a workshop to release and discuss the results presented in TNC
